title:
Limitations of emittance and source size measurement of
  laser-accelerated electron beams using the pepper-pot mask method
authors:
F. C. Salgado, A. Kozan, D. Seipt, D. Hollatz, P. Hilz, M. Kaluza, A.
  S\"avert, A. Seidel, D. Ullmann, Y. Zhao, and M. Zepf
abstract:
The pepper-pot method is a widely used technique originally proposed for
measuring the emittance of space-charge-dominated electron beams from
radio-frequency photoinjectors. With recent advances in producing
high-brightness electron beams via laser wakefield acceleration (LWFA), the
method has also been applied to evaluate emittance in this new regime [1-3]. In
this work, we explore the limitations of the method in inferring the emittance
and beam waist of LWFA electron beams, showing that the technique becomes
inaccurate for small emittance values.
